meanings.sent1: The kitten was babier than the cat.
meanings.sent2: She chose the babier dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: The babier cupcakes were a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: The babier flowers in the garden bloomed brightly.
meanings.sent5: The babier puppy wagged its tail excitedly.

meanings.definition: Someone who is younger or less experienced.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was the babier of the team.
meanings.sent2: She always looked out for the babier kids in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The babier of the siblings loved playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: In the group, he was the babier when it came to technology.
meanings.sent5: The babier in the class asked many questions to learn more.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as a baby.
meanings.sent1: She would babier her little sister when she was upset.
meanings.sent2: The coach would babier the injured player to ensure they recovered well.
meanings.sent3: He would babier his best friend whenever he was sick.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would babier the students during exam week.
meanings.sent5: The nurse would babier the elderly patient with care and compassion.
